page.title: 08CUBS AND BROWNIES IN COOKLEY
page.content: The children of the village have the opportunity to belong to several youth organisations. Foremost of which are the Scouting organisations. The Brownies, for girls upto 10, have regular meetings in the Parish hall. It is popular with First School children, though not all of them take up the opportunity to become Girl Guides. The boy's equivalent is the Cub Scouts. This too holds its meetings once a week in the Parish Hall.Again this is popular with the young boys, more of whom stay on to become Scouts.
